SEARCH
Package AlgorithmCode

Class HashLogicOpTransform

java.lang.Object
AlgorithmCode.HashLogicOpTransform
public class HashLogicOpTransform extends Object
Produces and verifies truth tables of logic gate transformation when hashed. If you take a codeword-produced 4x4 tile and combine it with another codeword-produced 4x4 tile via a bitwise 0-15 logic gate operation and rehash the tile, the logic operation between the original codewords and the result codeword becomes transformed into another logic operation. AND is 8, OR is 14.

A logic operation between two inputs pre-hash becomes a different logic operation within the hash. Using these truth tables, you can operate on hashed input without lossy inversion and without the original data, allowing for retroactive hashing

This class generates and verifies these operation transformations for all 0-15 logic gates and all 16 row-weighted hashes, the column-weighted hashes have an incomplete set of these transformations.

  • Method Details

    • testGate

      public void testGate(int gate, int[][] tupleDistro, boolean inRowError)
      This function tests a single 0-15 logic gate against all 16 minMax codeword sets rowError or columnError. This is a helper function for testAllGates()
      Parameters:
      gate - an integer representing a 0-15 logic gate, 8 = AND, 14 = OR, 6 = XOR
      tupleDistro - the output array passed from testAllGates()
      inRowError - if true uses the row-weighted truth tables; if false uses the column-weighted set

    • testAllLogic

      public void testAllLogic() throws IOException
      Hash logic transform generator. This is the main function that generates the truth tables and calls testGate() for individual rules
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message

    • verifyLogicOperationHash

      public void verifyLogicOperationHash(String filepath, boolean rowError) throws IOException
      This function verifies that the hash logic op transform truth tables are correct by: 1. hashing the bitmap 2. generate an array of some changes to be made to the bitmap 3. hashing the changed bitmap 4. hashing the changes 5. combine the hashed changes and hashed original bitmap using the appropriate generated logic gate 6. testing to see if these two seperate hash pathways generate the same thing
      Parameters:
      filepath - name of the bitmap, not including the directory path
      rowError - if true, uses the row-weighted codewords, if false uses the column-weighted codewords
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message

    • checkEveryGateEveryDepth

      public void checkEveryGateEveryDepth(String filepath) throws IOException
      Verifies the hashLogicOpTransform truth tables, by coming up with a bitmask and hashing it, hashing the original, applying the bitmask to a copy of the original and hashing that, then post-hash applying the appropriate logic gate transform and comparing the results.
      Parameters:
      filepath - a 2 byte integer bitmap located in the src/ImagesProcessed directory
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message

    • verifyLogicOperationHashSingleBit

      public void verifyLogicOperationHashSingleBit(String filepath, int gate, int depth, int[][][] differences, int[][][][] ones) throws IOException
      This function verifies that the hash logic op transform truth tables are correct by: 1. hashing the bitmap 2. generate an array of some changes to be made to the bitmap 3. hashing the changed bitmap 4. hashing the changes 5. combine the hashed changes and hashed original bitmap using the appropriate generated logic gate 6. testing to see if these two seperate hash pathways generate the same thing
      Parameters:
      filepath - name of the bitmap, not including the directory path
      gate - an integer 0..15 logic gate
      depth - how many iterations to hash
      differences - a counter array that keeps track of the number of discrepancies per depth per codeword per inverse
      ones - a counter array that keeps track of the number of 1 bits per depth per codeword per inverse, showing that it's not empty or static without having to output to a gif every single time
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message

    • verifyLogicOperationHash

      public void verifyLogicOperationHash(String filepath, int gate, int depth, int[][][] differences) throws IOException
      This function verifies that the hash logic op transform truth tables are correct by: 1. hashing the bitmap 2. generate an array of some changes to be made to the bitmap 3. hashing the changed bitmap 4. hashing the changes 5. combine the hashed changes and hashed original bitmap using the appropriate generated logic gate 6. testing to see if these two seperate hash pathways generate the same thing
      Parameters:
      filepath - name of the bitmap, not including the directory path
      gate - an integer 0..15 logic gate
      depth - how many iterations of hash to do
      differences - a counter array that keeps track of the number of discrepancies per depth per codeword per type inverse
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message

    • generateOperation

      public int[][] generateOperation(int rows, int cols)
      Generates a binary array of some changes with which to test the internal hash operation transform
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows to output
      cols - number of columns to output
      Returns:
      a random array of size (row, cols)

    • analyzeHashLogicOpIncompletions

      public void analyzeHashLogicOpIncompletions() throws IOException
      An experimental function that assesses the incompletions in the column weighted error table. It also attempts to prove a codeword's limits as a universal set by brute forcing combinations of the logic gates that codeword does have
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message

    • analyzeHashLogicOpIncompletionsFourAxis

      public void analyzeHashLogicOpIncompletionsFourAxis() throws IOException
      Another version of an analysis of the incompletions in the column-weighted error score logic operation transform, also another version of brute forcing the limits of what gates the incomplete codewords do have
      Throws:
      IOException - prints a message
